result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michele M Ford

records.addlTxt: Atty. Plummer informed the clerk that Ms. Ford has been transported and requests the 10/27/22 motion hearing be vacated.  Return on doctor's report scheduled on 11/16/22 at 10:30 via Zoom.

Defendant Michele M Ford appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Michele M Ford.  Attorney Dax Odom appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Doctor's Report Return hearing held. Court is in receipt of a report from the examining psychologist finding the defendant to be not competent but likely to regain competency. Court adopts the findings. Defense requests a Motion to Show Cause hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the court, the 11/15/22 hearing is rescheduled to 10/17/22 at 3:00 via Zoom.  rmm
from Dr. Sanchez requesting an extension to file the report, filed.  rmm

Defendant Michele M Ford in court via zoom and with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Michele M Ford in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.  The Court ordered proceedings suspended.  Court ordered defendant committed to Department of Health and Family Services in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.   Defendant is remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation FORTHWITH to the designated facility.  Order signed and filed.  Case is adjourned for doctor report in Br 1.  mn  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services.  signed, filed, and emailed to Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
No Contact Order_1 - Whitford, Steven W; Multiple Parties.docx, Filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Michele M Ford in court with Student Intern Peter Kafkas under the supervision of attorney Jeffry R. Schwartz.  Defendant Michele M Ford in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michele M Ford appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Due to defendant's lower pending cases, this case is reassigned to Judge Davila, Br. 1.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge *, Branch *.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
